net.sf.mmm.client.ui.api.attribute

Interface AttributeReadSelectedValue<VALUE>

  • Type Parameters:
    VALUE - is the generic type of the selectable values.
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    AttributeWriteSelectedValue<VALUE>, AttributeWriteSelectedValueAdvanced<VALUE>, UiFeatureSelectedValue<VALUE>, UiWidgetAbstractDataSet<ITEM>, UiWidgetAbstractDataTable<ROW>, UiWidgetAbstractListTable<ROW>, UiWidgetAbstractTree<NODE>, UiWidgetListBase<ROW>, UiWidgetListBoxField<VALUE>, UiWidgetListTable<ROW>, UiWidgetOptionListTable<ROW>, UiWidgetTree<NODE>, UiWidgetTreeTable<NODE>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractUiWidgetAbstractDataSet, AbstractUiWidgetAbstractDataTable, AbstractUiWidgetAbstractListTable, AbstractUiWidgetListTable, AbstractUiWidgetTree, UiWidgetAdapterTestSelectedValue, UiWidgetAdapterTestTree, UiWidgetCustomAbstractListTable, UiWidgetCustomListTable, UiWidgetListTableGwt, UiWidgetTreeGwt, UiWidgetTreeTestImpl

    public interface AttributeReadSelectedValue<VALUE>
    This interface gives read access to the selected value(s) (items) of an object.
    Since:
    1.0.0
    Author:
    Joerg Hohwiller (hohwille at users.sourceforge.net)
    See Also:
    SelectionMode

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      VALUE getSelectedValue()
      This method gets the currently selected value (item).
      Collection<VALUE> getSelectedValues()
      This method gets the currently selected values.
      int getSelectionCount()
      Logically the same as getSelectedValues().size() but more efficient.
      boolean hasSelectedValue() 

    • Method Detail

      • hasSelectedValue

        boolean hasSelectedValue()
        Returns:
        true if at least one value is selected, false otherwise.

      • getSelectedValue

        VALUE getSelectedValue()
        This method gets the currently selected value (item).
        Returns:
        the selected value or null if no value is selected.

      • getSelectedValues

        Collection<VALUE> getSelectedValues()
        This method gets the currently selected values. The order of the returned Collection is unspecified.
        Returns:
        the Collection with all selected values. Will be empty if nothing is selected.
        See Also:
        getSelectedValue()

      • getSelectionCount

        int getSelectionCount()
        Logically the same as getSelectedValues().size() but more efficient.
        Returns:
        the number of selected values.
